main event: On September 10, 1951, an unusual sighting of an unidentified object was reported near Andrews Air Force Base in Washington D.C. The object appeared as a streak of blue flame, changed to white, and was estimated to be traveling at a speed of over 500 miles per hour, ultimately disappearing without a trace.
interesting points: The object was described as a streak of blue flame followed by a change to white, making it appear to have mass and shape.
The estimated speed of the object was over 500 miles per hour, indicating extraordinary velocity for the time.
The observation lasted only 5 seconds, yet it left a lasting impression on the witnesses, leading them to exclude conventional explanations like jet aircraft or rocket exhaust.
The sighting took place at night with bright moonlight, providing ideal visibility for the observation.
The report was initially delayed due to a misunderstanding in handling this type of information, hinting at potential bureaucratic hurdles faced in reporting such sightings.
sighted object: Unidentified streak of blue flame changing to white at high speed
location: Andrews Air Force Base, Washington D.C.
witnesses: Air Force personnel including a Captain and co-pilot
photographs: The report does not mention any photographs
